Row.Text: Kiviuq
Qilakitsoq
Always Long to be Roaming
Likes civilizations who send out explorers. Dislikes civilizations that do not explore.
(You sent out many explorers)
Kiviuq considers you a fellow explorer
(You neglect exploration)
Kiviuq thinks you are close-minded and afraid of adventure

A vast expanse lies before you, heroic Kiviuq, eternal wanderer. Your people are a pious and cultured one, with relics beyond comparison and legends beyond belief. Send your hunters out to hunt for whales, and let your Angakkuit duel with Sedna so that you may have good fortune. But do not forget to explore, and lead your scouts out to the ends of the horizon. Fight hard and overcome odds, and above all do not let your heart turn to stone.
A Heart Not Made of Stone

All Cities generate +10% [ICON_FAITH] Faith for every Reconnaissance unit with at least 1 Promotion. Reconnaissance units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement and +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength while on Tundra, Snow, Tundra Hills, or Snow Hills terrain.
A Heart Not Made of Stone
Reconnaissance units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement and +10 Combat Strength while on Tundra, Snow, Tundra Hills, or Snow Hills terrain.
A Heart Not Made of Stone
+10% [ICON_FAITH] Faith for every Reconnaissance unit with at least 1 Promotion.
A Heart Not Made of Stone
Reconnaissance units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement and +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength while on Tundra, Snow, Tundra Hills, or Snow Hills terrain.
+{1_Amount} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Boreal Conditions.
+{1_Amount} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Tundra, Snow, Tundra Hills or Snow Hills terrain.
Kiviuq
Hero of the North
Elders say that he is in his last life now, on an adventure somewhere. However, before he dies he will return to see his people.

Kiviuq, or Qivioq, is a legendary Thule and then Inuit hero who appears in many unipkaaqs (epic sagas that took place in an indefinite past called taimmani). He is an eternal adventurer, forever sojourning across the land by foot, dogsled, umiak, or by huge fish. He uses his supernatural powers to overcome arnirniit spirits, gods, giants, cannibals, bears, and sea monsters, as well as numerous other obstacles during his travels.

One well-known legend of Kiviuq tells of his friendship with the grandson of an old woman. Everyone abuses and makes fun of the boy except Kiviuq. The old woman decides to get revenge. She changes her grandson into a seal and has him swim out to sea. The men follow the seal, intending to hunt it. Before the hunters reach it, however, the old woman creates a storm and drowns everyone but the seal and Kiviuq. The seal swims safely back to shore, where the old woman turns him back into a boy.

Kiviuq is said to have fought the storm for several days, and drifts away in his kayak continuing his adventures and living with people of many foreign lands. But during this struggle, he slowly began to turn to stone. In modern times, it is believed that half of his face has turned to stone, and that the world will end when his heart finally stops beating. Alaskan peoples have given him a new epithet – Qajartuarungnertoq, meaning ‘He who shall always long to go roaming in his kayak.’

Oral tradition has preserved many versions of the Kiviuq story-cycle, and today, a new generation of storytellers is bringing the tales to life in written or graphic form. The resurgence of Eskimo culture drew attention back to Kiviuq, and in the year 2000 a moon of Saturn was named after him, albeit a small non-spherical one. Kiviuq's legend continues to grow ever larger, and now it has even taken him to the stars.
Kiviuq's abilities encourages great exploration, while the base Thule are able to quickly build a strong cultural and religious base in an otherwise uninhabitable landscape.

The Thule were a highly religious and artistic people whose way of life relied largely on hunting Bowhead whales. The Angakkuit allows the Thule to turn a polar region into a livable environment through whaling, while the "Hunting of the Bowhead" ability as well as the Whalebone House unique district turn these whales into a Religious or Cultural Victory. Kiviuq's "A Heart Not Made of Stone" ability will help Thule scout out good places to settle and directly assist in increasing faith generation.
Hail, fellow adventurer! I am Kiviuq, and my tribe is of the Thule people. Do you too have a wanderer's heart?
The season's ripe to hunt Bowhead, and I'm going on a hunting trip. Would you like to join?
Agreed.
Life is full of chances to adventure. Would you make the journey to see my homelands?
Greetings.
Thank you, this offering is nicely decorated. I'll make sure to visit your lands some day.
I fear it's tirigusuusiit. I should not agree.
I have sent scouts to your lands bearing gifts of whale meat and decorated hunting knives. Would you allow them to see your cities and tell their unipkaaqs?
Excellent! Such vast new lands to explore.
Ah, can't you explore somewhere else?
I've heard many legends from your realm. Could I travel there and see if they're true?
I would be proud to call you friend.
I'm afraid that my path goes elsewhere.
It is piqujait! I will gladly join you.
Thank you.
It is foolish to go alone - Amaruq hunts lone travellers. I can overcome him, but I fear for your sake.
You are not unlike an Agloolik. Would you be interested in going on an adventure?
Go far, and may your travels be eventful.
You are no traveller. Only an obstacle, that I will overcome.
Those do not look like adventurers on my border. Or hunters. In fact, they appear to be invaders. My eyes aren't stone yet.
{LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_LIME_THULE_DAVE_ANY}
{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_LIME_THULE_DAVE_ANY}
You risk infuriating Sedna! Do you intend to drag us all down your path?
If you do not see the world, how else can you protect our people?! How else can you approach destiny?!
(You are not exploring.)
This is not a war. This is an adventure! One that will make a fine story of how aggressors shall always be defeated.
You are backward and weak-willed and scared of the wild. Now you see what it brings you. Now you meet the storm.
Very well. Angakkuit shall ask Sedna to forgive us.
I am no fool, and the North Wind hasn't dulled my wits yet.
Winter is coming, we should both be preparing for it. Can we agree to this truce?
I suppose this is it. My last adventure. The last obstacle I couldn't overcome, it was you in the end. I can feel my heart beating slower, and now I turn to stone. I feel cold... so cold...
You didn't have to be my enemy; I only ever wanted to explore. In fact, in a way I envy you - now you make that journey to Adlivun, one that I've never had the chance for.
Chief
High Chief
Issumatak
Inua
Umialik
Sangilak
Issorartuyok
Chairman
Prime Minister
War Chief
Illituyok
Kadzaq
Kingudlerk
